q: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
h:
“Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.” —
Helen Keller

q: An intelligent person hires people who are more intelligent than he is.
h:
“An intelligent person hires people who are more intelligent than he is.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Imagination is the beginning of creation.
h:
“Imagination is the beginning of creation.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
h:
“Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.” —
Soren Kierkegaard

q: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
h:
“Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Great ones are willing to get burned time and again as they sharpen their swords in the fire.
h:
“Great ones are willing to get burned time and again as they sharpen their swords in the fire.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Every blessing ignored becomes a curse.
h:
“Every blessing ignored becomes a curse.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: We've got to live, no matter how many skies have fallen.
h:
“We've got to live, no matter how many skies have fallen.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Before preparing to improve the world, first look around your own home three times.
h:
“Before preparing to improve the world, first look around your own home three times. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.
h:
“Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.” —
Yoko Ono

q: A fool sees himself as another, but a wise man sees others as himself.
h:
“A fool sees himself as another, but a wise man sees others as himself.” —
Dogen

q: If you are not living each day with excitement, energy, and passion, then you are not living true to your life purpose.
h:
“If you are not living each day with excitement, energy, and passion, then you are not living true to your life purpose.” —
Celestine Chua

q: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers.
h:
“The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Respect is earned by effort not age, all things age without effort.
h:
“Respect is earned by effort not age, all things age without effort.” —
C. Sean McGee

q: Words can only have a positive effect on others if and when they are ready to listen.
h:
“Words can only have a positive effect on others if and when they are ready to listen.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.
h:
“The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.
h:
“Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.” —
Steve Jobs

q: All human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes.
h:
“All human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
h:
“Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Rather than waste time and energy worrying, use that time and energy to constructively deal with whatever is causing the worry.
h:
“Rather than waste time and energy worrying, use that time and energy to constructively deal with whatever is causing the worry.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Just as true humor is laughter at oneself, true humanity is knowledge of oneself.
h:
“Just as true humor is laughter at oneself, true humanity is knowledge of oneself.” —
Alan Watts

q: Pain doesn't last. And when it's gone, we have something to show for it. Growth.
h:
“Pain doesn't last. And when it's gone, we have something to show for it. Growth.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: You are not only responsible for what you say, but also for what you do not say.
h:
“You are not only responsible for what you say, but also for what you do not say. ” —
Martin Luther

q: Wherever you are is the entry point.
h:
“Wherever you are is the entry point.” —
Kabir

q: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
h:
“It is never too late to be what you might have been.” —
George Eliot

q: The only lost cause is one we give up on before we enter the struggle.
h:
“The only lost cause is one we give up on before we enter the struggle.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: Every moment of happiness requires a great amount of Ignorance
h:
“Every moment of happiness requires a great amount of Ignorance” —
Honore de Balzac

q: The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart wants what the heart wants.
h:
“The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart wants what the heart wants.” —
Stephen King

q: A clever person turns great troubles into little ones, and little ones into none at all.
h:
“A clever person turns great troubles into little ones, and little ones into none at all. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Everything around us is made up of energy. To attract positive things in your life, start by giving off positive energy.
h:
“Everything around us is made up of energy. To attract positive things in your life, start by giving off positive energy.” —
Celestine Chua

q: If you try, you might get exactly what you want. If you don't, you don't.
h:
“If you try, you might get exactly what you want. If you don't, you don't.” —
Unknown

q: A mentor is someone who sees more talent and ability within you, than you see in yourself, and helps bring it out of you.
h:
“A mentor is someone who sees more talent and ability within you, than you see in yourself, and helps bring it out of you.” —
Bob Proctor

q: He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.
h:
“He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.” —
Aristotle

q: One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die.
h:
“One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: Failure is the key to success; each mistake teaches us something.
h:
“Failure is the key to success; each mistake teaches us something.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.
h:
“Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
h:
“You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.” —
Stephen King

q: It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.
h:
“It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.
h:
“A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.” —
James Allen

q: Change is hard at first, messy in the middle and gorgeous at the end.
h:
“Change is hard at first, messy in the middle and gorgeous at the end.” —
Robin Sharma

q: You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.
h:
“You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
h:
“Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Make your life a mission - not an intermission.
h:
“Make your life a mission - not an intermission.” —
Unknown

q: To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.
h:
“To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.” —
Alexander Pope

q: Darkness is the absence of light.
h:
“Darkness is the absence of light.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Be as fluid as water, do not give your enemies anything solid to attack.
h:
“Be as fluid as water, do not give your enemies anything solid to attack.” —
Robert Greene

q: A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.
h:
“A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: You were born to win, but to be a winner you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.
h:
“You were born to win, but to be a winner you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Words are the clothes thoughts wear.
h:
“Words are the clothes thoughts wear.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!
h:
“Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!” —
Alfred Adler
